main event: A round object, the size of a pen, pale reddish-yellow, was spotted NE of Dayton, Ohio on 30 August 1957, appearing first as a tailing star and then rising very fast before passing out of sight.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 3 minutes,Multiple conclusions were drawn suggesting it could be a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object,There were 100 series aircraft in the area with afterburners on, which may have produced exhaust reflections,The witness described the object as having a dull grayish-white, aluminum-like appearance,The object disappeared from view as it faded into the sky.
sighted object: round object, size of a pen, pale reddish-yellow
witness description: Pvt. DeFord, who reported seeing the object while watching TV
